frameDefinitions: In this frame an Agent or Cause changes the consistency of a Patient from its Initial_state to a Result.
A Phenomenon, which may be an activity, state or object, is purposefully hidden from the awareness of a potential Cognizer.
A Cognizer construes an Item as belonging to a certain Category.
An Agent (the punisher or rewarder) performs a Response_action on an Evaluee for a Reason, the Evaluee's actions or beliefs.
An Assessor examines a Phenomenon to figure out its Value according to some Feature of the Phenomenon.
A Competition comes to an end, with a Competitor tying, winning, or losing against an Opponent (or opponents) according to their Score.
frameExamples: Donna <t>thinned</t> the soup with chicken broth.
Few people would use ATMs if the content of their transaction was <t>secret</t> from their bank and there was no paper trail verifying the transaction. .
You 've already <t>stereotyped</t> me as a bimbo, have n't you?
His <t>punishment</t> of the prisoners was too harsh.
Each company is then <t>evaluated</t> for their earning potential. CNI
Unbelievable--he <t>lost</t> the gold medal by just .02 points!
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Patient</fen> is the entity that undergoes a change.
The <fen>Agent</fen> causes the change of consistency in the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-<fen>Agent</fen> which brings about the change in the <fen>Patient</fen>.
When the <fen>Patient</fen> changes consistency.
Where the the <fen>Patient</fen> changes consistency.
The <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is the activity, state or object that is purposefully hidden from the awareness of a potential cognizer.
A period of <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is hidden from the awareness of potential cognizers.
This is the person who performs an act of categorization. Typically, this frame element is expressed as an External Argument.
This is the entity which is construed or treated by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> as being an instance of a particular <fen>Category</fen>. Typically, the <fen>Item</fen> is expressed as an Object.

This frame element expresses a general type or class of which the <fen>Item</fen> is considered an instance. Typically, it is expressed in a prepositional phrase headed by <ment>as</ment> or <ment>under</ment>.

This frame element expresses properties of the <fen>Item</fen> which is used as a basis for categorization. <fen>Criteria</fen> are the general dimensions along which <fen>Item</fen>s can potentially differ from one another and hence, fall into different <fen>Category</fen>s. For example, a paint sample can be classified <ment>by color</ment> or <ment>by finish (matte or gloss)</ment>; if they are classified by color, one can be classified <ment>as orange</ment> and another <ment>as red</ment>. The <fen>Criteria</fen> role is typically expressed as a PP headed by <ment>by</ment>, or as a complex PP of the form <ment>on the basis of...</ment>:
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate when a certain Categorization was made.
<fen>Evaluee</fen> is the person or thing about whom/which a judgment has made and to whom reward/punishment is dealt. With verbs, the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is typically expressed as Object.
Typically, there is a constituent expressing the <fen>Reason</fen> for the <fen>Agent</fen>'s judgment. It is usually a 'for'-PP, e.g.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person doing the rewarding or punishing.
The reward or punishment given to the <fen>Evaluee</fen> by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The sentient entity that evaluates the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The entity whose <fen>Value</fen> according to a <fen>Feature</fen> is being measured.
The type of property or feature that the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is being judged on.
An event or procedure that allows the <fen>Assessor</fen> to evaluate the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Assessor</fen> to make the assessment.
The time at which the <fen>Assessor</fen> makes the assessment.
The location where the assessing takes place.
The individual involved in the <fen>Competition</fen>.
The individual that the <fen>Competitor</fen> has been competing against.
The individuals who compete against each other.
The event in which the <fen>Competitors</fen> compete with each other.
The time at which the <fen>Competition</fen> takes place.
The location at which the <fen>Competition</fen> takes place.
listRoleExamples: There was stuff in there that was 'secret' <fex>in the 1980s</fex>, but has since become pretty common knowledge.
<fex>Kim</fex> categorized the books under fiction. <fex>Kim</fex> categorized them on the basis of genre.
The students were categorized <fex>on the basis of their test scores</fex>.
<fex>20 years ago</fex> people would consider this as nothing unusual
The boss rewarded <fex>you</fex> for your diligence.
<fex>Jake's</fex> rewards to his best workers were very generous.
If a person be guilty of impiety let him be punished <fex>with death</fex>.
You will also be graded <fex>on your speed of response</fex> .
<fex>The study</fex> evaluated the risk of a major quake.
<fex>This chapter</fex> evaluates the far-left's contribution to the environmentalism debate since the '70's .
The committee rated Smithers ' most loyal servant ' <fex>about a week ago</fex> .
They 'll evaluate you <fex>in that room over there</fex> , and then you 're free to go .

sourceCandidateSpans.text: The Energy and Resources Conservation Board
